column4: Control_Desc
The Company deploys systems in to its environment in accordance with established baseline configurations.
The Company monitors for changes to configuration settings and critical files within The Company systems.
The Company restricts access and/or permissions to install software to authorized individuals.
The Company updates established baseline configurations to reflect changes in requirements on a [INSERT TIME FRAME] basis.
The Company restricts program execution for systems deployed in its FedRAMP boundaries.
The Company maintains network diagrams and documentation describing the network topology which are reviewed and updated as needed.
The Company configures network devices to mitigate network security threats.
The Company restricts unnecessary network services, ports, and protocols, and monitors communications at external network boundaries and between internal networks.
The Company permits external network connections from its network through boundary protection devices or services.
The Company monitors its network for performance and capacity to maintain availability.
The Company regularly reviews and revises its segmentation strategy, policies, and methods on a [INSERT TIME FRAME] basis.
The Company physically or logically separates its network based on function and class of data.

The Company separates its network by function with the user network segmented from production, non-production and internet-facing networks. Network design and implementation considers the principles of least privilege.
The Company implements and maintains controls to identify and prevent unauthorized devices from accessing its physical network.
The Company implements and maintains controls to identify and prevent unauthorized devices from accessing its wireless network.
The Company implements and maintains controls to identify and prevent unauthorized devices from remotely accessing the network.
The Company maintains an inventory of Assets.
Hardware Technology Assets must be requested and approved.
Assets are securely disposed of, if no longer required.
Media is securely sanitized prior to disposal, release, or re-use.
Scope for regulatory compliance requirements is identified and documented.
The Company tracks and reports on End Of Service Life ("EOSL") for hardware and software.
The asset inventory is validated and updated on a [INSERT TIME FRAME] basis.

For The Company systems deployed in its FedRAMP boundaries, automated mechanisms to scan for, detect, and remediate the presence of unauthorized hardware, software, and firmware components are implemented.
Scope for The Company's authorization boundaries is identified and documented.
The Company maintains a Change Management Policy that identifies requirements for changes, roles, responsibilities, and management commitment.
The Company reviews proposed changes to systems and approves or disapproves changes after consideration for change type, business need, impact, and risk.
The Company has established a Change Advisory Board (CAB) to review changes categorized as Risk 1 or Risk 2.

The Company uses a change management system to track and document production changes. The ticket tracking system maintains history, identifies details of the change and has a method of approval/sign-off.
The Company's Change Management Team performs an audit of changes to ensure change documentation meets The Company Change Management Policy.
A security strategy is established, documented, maintained, communicated and reviewed [INSERT TIME FRAME].

A budgeting process to fund security and technology capital and operational expenditures, including ensuring the security and technology organizations are adequately staffed and funded, has been defined and implemented.
The System Development Life Cycle (SDLC) methodology and supporting processes and tools are defined, maintained, reviewed and approved on a [INSERT TIME FRAME] basis.
System development and information security roles and responsibilities are defined and communicated.

The organization controls changes to systems within the System Development Life Cycle (SDLC) through formal, documented, and implemented change control procedures that incorporate information security considerations.
Use of production data in non-production environments is prohibited.
Production environments are logically separate from non-production environments.
Organizational communication and data flows (i.e. system designs,  data flow diagrams) for applications and systems are documented and updated [INSERT TIME FRAME].
A Privacy strategy is established, documented, maintained, communicated and reviewed [INSERT TIME FRAME].
A budgeting process to fund Privacy capital and operational expenditures, including ensuring the Privacy organization is adequately staffed and funded, has been defined and implemented.

Data devaluation requirements to protect The Company sensitive data at rest, in use, and in transit, is defined, established, implemented and communicated to support compliance with applicable laws, regulations, customer contracts, and industry standards relating to information security. Requirements are reviewed, approved and updated, as necessary, on at least an annual basis.
Sensitive data is protected at rest in accordance with established data devaluation requirements.
Sensitive data is protected in transit in accordance with established data devaluation requirements.
The Company owned laptops and mobile devices employ full disk encryption.
Cryptographic key management requirements are defined, established, implemented, and maintained.
Access to cryptographic keys is restricted to authorized personnel and appropriately stored, protected, and maintained, in accordance with defined requirements.
Cryptographic mechanisms have been implemented to protect data integrity in transit.
Cryptographic mechanisms have been implemented to verify the authenticity of software prior to installation.
A formal digital certificate management program, including supporting requirements and management documentation, technology, and inventory, is defined, established, implemented, and maintained.
